intro: Tetrastigma yiwuense, commonly known as the Yiwu crossvine, is a woody vine native to China. It belongs to the grape family (Vitaceae) and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by red berries that are edible. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
